page.title: 16Travelling to School
page.content: The school in{Caerau}serves a wide catchment area so there are children who must either catch a bus or walk a long distance. Children living in other parts of the valley who attend the{Welsh School}are provided with transport, either a bus or taxi. For those children who have to rely on public transport changes in the timetable lead to confusion. Mothers who have children in both Caerau Nursery and Blaen Llynfi Infants face the added problem as there is a considerable distance between the two buildings, some children are lucky enough to be conveyed to school by car, this can create congestion outside the school especially on wet days. In Summer some ride bicycles to school but there are no facilities for keeping them safely.
